publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1503 Mr Brian Monteith: Sir James Shand—That the Parliament expresses its regret and sadness following the recent death of Sir Jimmy Shand at the age of 92; records its thanks for his outstanding and unique contribution to the promotion of Scottish dance music since his first recording in 1933; notes that he was recognised as an outstanding exponent of Scottish accordion music throughout the world; commends his sterling work in maintaining and reviving interest in this important aspect of Scottish culture against fierce competition from new forms of contemporary music from the 1950s throughout to the 1990s and offers its sympathy and condolences to his wife and family and his many friends. Supported by: David McLetchie*, Mary Scanlon*

S1M-1503 Mr Brian Monteith: Sir James Shand—That the Parliament expresses its regret and sadness following the recent death of Sir Jimmy Shand at the age of 92; records its thanks for his outstanding and unique contribution to the promotion of Scottish dance music since his first recording in 1933; notes that he was recognised as an outstanding exponent of Scottish accordion music throughout the world; commends his sterling work in maintaining and reviving interest in this important aspect of Scottish culture against fierce competition from new forms of contemporary music from the 1950s throughout to the 1990s and offers its sympathy and condolences to his wife and family and his many friends. Supported by: David McLetchie, Mary Scanlon
S1M-1503 Sir James Shand (lodged on 4 January 2001) Donald Gorrie*, Alex Johnstone*, Phil Gallie*, Nora Radcliffe*, Mr Keith Harding*
S1M-1503 Sir James Shand (lodged on 4 January 2001) Michael Russell*, Alex Fergusson*, Tricia Marwick*
S1M-1503 Sir James Shand (lodged on 4 January 2001) Mr Jamie McGrigor*, Dr Richard Simpson*

Supported by: David McLetchie, Mary Scanlon, Donald Gorrie, Alex Johnstone, Phil Gallie, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Keith Harding, Michael Russell, Alex Fergusson, Tricia Marwick, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Dr Richard Simpson
S1M-1503 Sir James Shand (lodged on 4 January 2001) Mr David Davidson*

S1M-1503 Sir James Shand (lodged on 4 January 2001) Cathy Peattie*

S1M-1503 Mr Brian Monteith: Sir James Shand—That the Parliament expresses its regret and sadness following the recent death of Sir Jimmy Shand at the age of 92; records its thanks for his outstanding and unique contribution to the promotion of Scottish dance music since his first recording in 1933; notes that he was recognised as an outstanding exponent of Scottish accordion music throughout the world; commends his sterling work in maintaining and reviving interest in this important aspect of Scottish culture against fierce competition from new forms of contemporary music from the 1950s throughout to the 1990s and offers its sympathy and condolences to his wife and family and his many friends. Supported by: David McLetchie, Mary Scanlon, Donald Gorrie, Alex Johnstone, Phil Gallie, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Keith Harding, Michael Russell, Alex Fergusson, Tricia Marwick, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Dr Richard Simpson, Mr David Davidson, Fiona Hyslop, Linda Fabiani, Irene McGugan, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Bill Aitken, Cathy Peattie
